item.title: 亚马逊在英国面临零售商和消费者价值高达 54 亿美元的诉讼
item.description: 亚马逊因涉嫌滥用其市场支配地位而面临零售商和消费者价值高达 40 亿英镑（约合 54 亿美元）的两起大规模诉讼，伦敦一家法庭周四证明这两起案件可以继续审理。【原文：Amazon faces two mass lawsuits from retailers and consumers worth up to 4 billion pounds ($5.4 billion) for allegedly abusing its dominant position, after a London tribunal on Thursday certified the cases could proceed.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚广播公司新闻频道（CBS News）在特朗普官司之后任命坦尼娅-西蒙为《60 分钟》的新老板
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）旗下的哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS News）周四任命谭雅-西蒙（Tanya Simon）为其黄金时段新闻杂志广播节目《60 分钟》的执行制片人，接替以缺乏编辑独立性为由下台的比尔-欧文斯（Bill Owens）。【原文：Paramount Global's CBS News on Thursday appointed Tanya Simon as the executive producer of its prime time news magazine broadcast "60 Minutes", in place of Bill Owens, who had stepped down citing lack of editorial independence.】

item.title: 加拿大零售业因关税影响而萎缩，6 月份有望好转
item.description: 周四的数据显示，由于消费者减少购买汽车，在超市、便利店和酒类上的消费减少，加拿大5月份的零售额下降了1.1%。【原文：Canada's retail sales shrank by 1.1% in May as consumers curtailed car purchases and spent less at supermarkets, convenience stores and on alcohol, data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 6 月新屋销售低于预期；住房供应增加
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率上升，6 月份美国新建独栋住宅的销量增幅低于预期，库存量达到了 2007 年底的水平，这可能使住宅建设继续受到抑制。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes increased less than expected in June amid higher mortgage rates, pushing inventory to levels last seen in late 2007, which could keep homebuilding subdued.】

item.title: 马斯克称视频分享应用 Vine 将 "以人工智能的形式 "回归
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体公司 X 将以 "人工智能形式 "重新推出流行的视频分享平台 Vine，这位亿万富翁级的科技企业家在该应用停用近九年后的本周四表示。【原文：Elon Musk's social media company X is bringing back popular video-sharing platform Vine in "AI form", the billionaire tech-entrepreneur said on Thursday, almost nine years after the app was discontinued.】

item.title: 英特尔胜诉320亿美元股价暴跌引发的股东诉讼
item.description: 联邦法官驳回了一起指控英特尔欺诈股东的诉讼，该诉讼指控英特尔隐瞒了为外部客户生产芯片的业务中存在的问题，导致其市值单日暴跌 320 亿美元。【原文：A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit accusing Intel of defrauding shareholders by concealing problems in a business where it manufactured chips for outside customers, leading to a $32 billion one-day plunge in its market value.】

item.title: 美国商务部长卢特尼克称，TikTok 必须退出中国控制，由美国控制算法
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周四告诉CNBC，TikTok必须脱离中国的控制，华盛顿应监督该社交媒体平台的算法。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told CNBC on Thursday that TikTok must be taken out of Chinese control and that Washington should oversee the social media platform's algorithm.】

item.title: 欧盟监管机构将调查 KKR 是否在意大利电信交易中提供了误导性信息
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四表示，欧盟反垄断监管机构将调查美国投资公司 KKR 在以 220 亿欧元（260 亿美元）收购意大利电信公司（TIM）固网交易中是否提供了错误或误导性信息。【原文：EU antitrust regulators will investigate whether U.S. investment firm KKR provided incorrect or misleading information in its 22-billion-euro ($26 billion) acquisition of Telecom Italia's (TIM) fixed-line network deal, the European Commission said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普表示希望马斯克及其公司在美国蓬勃发展
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，他不会通过取消联邦补贴来摧毁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的公司，并表示他希望这位亿万富翁科技企业家的企业能够蓬勃发展。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would not destroy Elon Musk's companies by taking away federal subsidies and said he wants the billionaire tech-entrepreneur's businesses to thrive.】

item.title: 美国商业活动增长；关税加剧通胀担忧
item.description: 美国 7 月份的商业活动有所回升，但企业要求提高商品和服务价格，这支持了经济学家的观点，即通胀将在下半年加速，主要原因是对进口商品征收关税。【原文：U.S. business activity picked up in July, but companies asked higher prices for goods and services, supporting economists' views that inflation will accelerate in the second half of the year mainly because of tariffs on imports.】

item.title: Blackstone 首席执行官表示正在为所投资公司的 IPO 做准备
item.description: Blackstone 首席执行官 Stephen Schwarzman 周四表示，该资产管理公司正准备在未来几个季度将其所投资的一些公司进行首次公开募股。【原文：Blackstone CEO Stephen Schwarzman said on Thursday the asset manager is preparing some of its portfolio companies for initial public offerings over the next few quarters.】

item.title: 关税和政治因素使央行大幅降息放缓
item.description: 随着早期行动者的宽松周期接近尾声，央行的降息步伐正在放缓，而通胀率的胶着则让其他行动者保持谨慎。【原文：The pace of central bank rate cuts is slowing as early movers near the end of their easing cycles while sticky inflation keeps others cautious.】

item.title: Ameriprise Financial 季度利润因手续费收入增加而增长
item.description: 资产和财富管理公司 Ameriprise Financial 周四报告称，第二季度利润增长 28%，原因是季末市场反弹将其产生费用的资产价值推高至历史新高。【原文：Asset and wealth manager Ameriprise Financial reported a 28% rise in its second-quarter profit on Thursday, as a late-quarter market rally boosted the value of its fee-generating assets to a record high.】

item.title: 联合太平洋公司正在讨论与竞争对手诺福克公司合并，达成超大型铁路交易
item.description: 联合太平洋公司周四表示，它正在与竞争对手诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）就可能的合并进行深入讨论。【原文：Union Pacific said on Thursday it was in advanced discussions with rival Norfolk Southern for a possible merger.】

item.title: 受关税影响，Acerinox 着眼于为美国业务提价
item.description: 钢铁制造商宏兴集团（Acerinox）的美国业务是唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统关税的一大受益者，该公司管理层周四表示，正在考虑提高部分市场价格，但预计在9月底之前不会有明显变化。【原文：Steelmaker Acerinox , whose U.S. business is a big beneficiary of President Donald Trump's tariffs, is looking into raising some prices in the market, though no notable changes are expected before late September, its management said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数意外下降
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数量意外下降，表明劳动力市场状况稳定，但招聘低迷使许多下岗工人更难找到新的工作机会。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for jobless benefits unexpectedly fell last week, pointing to stable labor market conditions, though sluggish hiring is making it harder for many laid-off workers to land new opportunities.】

item.title: 墨西哥 7 月初通胀率降至央行目标范围内
item.description: 墨西哥的总体通胀率在 7 月上半月有所放缓，回落到央行的目标范围内，这也助长了人们对央行应继续降低拉美第二大经济体利率的预期。【原文：Mexico's headline inflation slowed in the first half of July, falling back within the central bank's target range and fueling expectations that the bank should continue to bring down interest rates in Latin America's second-largest economy.】

item.title: VIEW 欧洲央行在一年的宽松政策后保持利率稳定
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周四一如预期将利率稳定在 2%，在一年的宽松政策之后稍作休息，以等待欧洲与美国未来贸易关系的明朗化。【原文：The European Central Bank left interest rates steady at 2%, as expected on Thursday, taking a break after a year of policy easing to wait for clarity over Europe's future trade relations with the United States.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，尽管受到美国的限制，但价值 10 亿美元的英伟达人工智能芯片仍进入了中国市场
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，在华盛顿加强芯片出口管制后的三个月内，英伟达公司价值至少 10 亿美元的先进人工智能芯片被走私到中国。【原文：Nvidia's advanced artificial intelligence chips worth at least $1 billion were smuggled to China in the three months after Washington tightened chip export controls, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 诺华将向 Matchpoint 支付高达 10 亿美元的费用，以开发抗炎疗法
item.description: 瑞士制药商诺华将向美国生物技术公司 Matchpoint Therapeutics 支付高达 10 亿美元的费用，用于开发治疗多种炎症性疾病的口服药物。【原文：Swiss drugmaker Novartis will pay up to $1 billion to U.S. biotech Matchpoint Therapeutics to develop oral drugs for several inflammatory diseases.】

item.title: 联合太平洋铁路公司季度利润增长
item.description: 联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）周四公布第二季度利润增长，主要得益于多种运输方式对大宗货物和工业品运输的强劲需求。【原文：Union Pacific reported a rise in its second-quarter profit on Thursday, powered by robust demand for bulk and industrial shipments through multiple modes of transportation.】

item.title: 供应减少，欧盟开始监控废金属贸易
item.description: 欧盟委员会表示，在业界发出钢铁、铝和铜等废金属短缺和冶炼厂停产风险的严峻警告后，欧盟委员会已开始监控废金属的进出口情况。【原文：The European Commission has started monitoring imports and exports of scrap metal including steel, aluminium and copper after stark industry warnings of shortages and the risk of smelter shutdowns, it said.】

item.title: 摩托罗拉解决方案推出新功能，提高公共安全技术的透明度
item.description: 摩托罗拉解决方案公司（Motorola Solutions）周三表示，将在其安全和安保产品中引入人工智能标签，以提高人工智能在公共安全和企业安保领域应用的透明度。【原文：Motorola Solutions said on Wednesday it will introduce AI labels across its safety and security products, in a bid to increase transparency around the use of artificial intelligence in public safety and enterprise security.】

item.title: 纳斯达克利润超预期，市场波动提升交易量
item.description: 纳斯达克周四公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是市场波动推动了交易量的增长，同时纳斯达克同名交易所上半年的上市量创下自 2021 年以来的最高纪录。【原文：Nasdaq beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday, as volatile markets boosted trading volumes while first-half listings on its eponymous exchange hit their highest since 2021.】

item.title: 中国发布法律修订草案帮助遏制价格战
item.description: 在通货紧缩压力持续存在的情况下，中国于周四公布了价格法修正案草案，以遏制企业间的过度竞争和价格战。【原文：China released a draft amendment to its pricing law on Thursday as part of efforts to curb excessive competition and price wars among firms, amid persistent deflationary pressures.】

item.title: 需求稳定，国防承包商 L3Harris 上调 2025 年展望
item.description: 美国国防承包商 L3Harris 科技公司周四上调了全年业绩预期，第二季度业绩好于华尔街预期，原因是在地缘政治紧张局势加剧的情况下需求仍有弹性。【原文：U.S. defense contractor L3Harris Technologies raised its annual forecast and beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter results on Thursday, driven by resilient demand amid rising geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 由于售后服务和贝尔飞机需求强劲，飞机制造商德事隆利润超出预期
item.description: 飞机制造商德事隆（Textron）周四公布的第二季度利润和收入均超出预期，主要得益于对售后零部件和服务的强劲需求以及贝尔（Bell）部门的增长。【原文：Aircraft maker Textron beat second-quarter profit and revenue estimates on Thursday, helped by strong demand for aftermarket parts and services and growth in its Bell unit.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称力拓考虑出售钛业务
item.description: 三位消息人士透露，由于价格疲软、回报率低，力拓正在考虑出售其钛金属部门。【原文：Rio Tinto is considering a possible sale of its titanium unit due to weak prices and low returns, three sources said, just as incoming CEO Simon Trott will weigh up a restructuring of the world's second-largest miner when he takes over next month.】

item.title: 受美国需求推动，Keurig Dr Pepper 季度收入超出预期
item.description: Keurig Dr Pepper 周四公布的第二季度营收略高于华尔街预期，主要受其能量饮料和软饮料的强劲需求推动，尤其是在美国。【原文：Keurig Dr Pepper reported second-quarter slightly revenue above Wall Street expectations on Thursday, driven by strong demand for its energy drinks and soft beverages, especially in the U.S.】

item.title: Monte dei Paschi 首席执行官表示不考虑提高对 Mediobanca 的出价
item.description: 意大利托斯卡纳银行首席执行官周四在接受美国CNBC电视台采访时表示，由于目前的价格合理，意大利Monte dei Paschi银行不会考虑提高对Mediobanca的全股收购价。【原文：Italy's Monte dei Paschi is not considering improving its all-share bid for Mediobanca as the current price is fair, the Tuscan bank's chief executive said in an interview with Class CNBC on Thursday.】
